page.title: 05Leighfields Population
page.content: This area has never been densely populated. Now, only three farms are inhabited. The reason for the decline in population is the inaccessibility of the farms in relation to the surrounding villages. Schools are closing in the villages themselves and children have to travel to the nearby towns to be educated, and also for entertainment. The large arable farms mean fewer farm workers are required due to mechanisation and low wages mean jobs are sought elsewhere. Many of the remaining workers are elderly and may leave the area on retirement.
